subject: World Cup (Skiing)
Alpine Skiing
Skiing
lead_paragraph: Lindsey Vonn set an American record with her 19th women’s World Cup victory Sunday in a super-G in Tarvisio, Italy. Vonn, 24, won in 1 minute 21.72 seconds and surpassed the record held by Tamara McKinney. Vonn was second in a super-combined Friday and in a downhill Saturday. Bode Miller holds the United States men’s record with 31 wins.
